issues.description: The Rideable interface and implementing classes in the solution define messageOnRide(String equipment), but the problem statement and template expect messageOnRide() with no parameters. This parameter mismatch will cause students to implement the wrong signature and fail to satisfy the specified UML and template Main usage.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the Rideable interface with the problem specification by removing the equipment parameter: define String messageOnRide() in Rideable and update all implementing classes to use messageOnRide() with no arguments.
